meanings.sent1: The teacher scolded the class for acting like pissants during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: He always belittles others, calling them pissants behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: The boss jokingly referred to the lazy interns as pissants during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain was portrayed as a cunning pissant, deceiving everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was so arrogant, he saw everyone else as mere pissants in his grand plan.

meanings.definition: A small ant, especially one that is considered a nuisance.
meanings.sent1: The picnic was ruined by a swarm of pissants crawling all over the food.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to deal with pissants invading the flower beds.
meanings.sent3: The children squealed in horror as they discovered a trail of pissants in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The tiny pissants worked tirelessly to gather food for their colony.
meanings.sent5: The campers had to protect their snacks from the pesky pissants marching towards them.
